description: Field mappings for Slack Lists integration used by research_chan_daily_update.mjs

assignee.description: The person assigned to complete the task
assignee.note: This is a semantic field key, not an encoded column ID

requester.description: The person who requested/created the task
requester.note: Should NOT be used for @mentions in digest

due_date.note: This is a semantic field key, not an encoded column ID

completed.description: Checkbox indicating if task is complete
completed.note: DEPRECATED - Use status field instead for determining completion

title.note: This is a semantic field key

unknown_field_1.description: Unknown field - all items have same value
unknown_field_1.note: Purpose unknown, not used in digest

user_mappings.description: Email to Slack User ID mappings

digest_rules.overdue_threshold: Items with due date before today
digest_rules.urgent_threshold: Items due within 2 days (today or tomorrow)

steps: 1. Export raw data using slackLists.items.list API call
3. Cross-reference known item values from CSV export
5. Identify 1:1 mappings between option IDs and values
6. Verify mappings against CSV data for accuracy

notes: Column IDs starting with 'Col' are encoded identifiers specific to this Slack List
Option IDs starting with 'Opt' are dropdown values specific to each field
Semantic field keys like 'todo_assignee' and 'todo_due_date' are standard across Slack Lists
The todo_completed checkbox should NOT be used - rely on status dropdown instead
Some status options may map to multiple actual statuses - use most common mapping
